Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as the diff is at very low levels, it is very easy to solve, so when there is big hashrate, best to make it take as close to a minute as possible

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: before we know exactly how much hashrate there is

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: say after 4 fast blocks, it does an exponential decay from very high diff down to where it should be

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: at some point we get the next block and that diff goes onchain to help us

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as it is now, all we get is some very low diff that goes onchain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so 10000x the diff, exponentially decay it down, at some point it is solved, and we get an idea of the actual hashrate, onchain, on block 5

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if it solves immediate at 10000x, then next time start at 100000x

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe the way to look at it is that if the recent solve times are fast, we have a time budget available to check the "blood pressure", so boost the pressure way up, then reduce it until the next block is solved. somehow calibrate the range of diff and exponential decay to fit in the time budget we have
